topic.title: Hacking Redis
topic.body: doing a pentest on a CTF website and trying to hack Redis. I know Im supposed to upload my SSH public key to login in as a known user, but I keep getting stuck. One well written article about it even put that certain key features were changed to keep skiddies out of blowing up real Redis boxes that were unsecured, as apparently its a real problem with people leaving there Redis services open and unsecured. Any thoughts?

1_19jbACPsnTxWhqTnMYTfbxBBvx6xmD656r.body: I can FizzBuzz in python buddy, nice try

1_1HK5C3Uf8zvbbSb92ZP6EsfHKC59MXDcK9.body:
> [wcked](#comment_1_13ckmBVJ5JyU25buVy6THZiR5hyrFPWiqf): Can someone make a little topic about privileges escalation. Thanks guys

cronjob....google how to search for things that run as root but may be misconfigured to allow write access....also dirty cow but I image most of those are patched

1_11553Fm1cV9cYruFuVX5eLkXUMthjJUe6q.body: Never, assholes were fucking with the box got a shell
